fields.value: Census of Population and Housing, 1980 [United States]:  Master Area Reference File (MARF) 5

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Master Area Reference Files (MARFs) link geographic areas with their respective n
umeric codes. This data collection is a five-digit ZIP-code equivalency file created for the 1980 Census of Population and Housing. The data contain geographic items from Summary Tape Files 1A and 3A, as well as total population and housing unit counts. This equivalency file was created to allow users to prepare additional data summaries relevant to ZIP-code areas. The file enables users to equate detailed record files having ZIP codes with census geographic units. This national file is hierarchically sequenced by geographic area.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR I.A.1.c. Census Enumerations: Historical and Contemporary Population Characteristics, United States, Decennial Censuses, 1980 Census

fields.value: Version Date: 1992-02-16Version Text: 1992-02-16 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: This hierarchical file contains 589,491 records. There are seven possible record types sequenced as follows: (1) state (including the District of Columbia), (2) county, (3) minor civil division (MCD) or census county division (CCD), (4) place or segment within MCD/CCD or remainder of MCD/CCD, (5) census tract or block numbering area (BNA), (6) block group (BG) or, for areas not block-numbered, enumeration district (ED), and (7) school district or ZIP-code area. There are approximately 95 variables in the dataset.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
